summary: "Fences" is a play written by August Wilson in 1985. It tells a story about African Americans in the 1950s and is part of a bigger series of plays called the "Pittsburgh Cycle." The play won important awards, including the Pulitzer Prize for Drama and the Tony Award for Best Play. It started as a work in progress at the Eugene O'Neill Theater Center and later premiered at the Yale Repertory Theatre in 1985.
title: Fences (play)
